lines.text:
[to Samantha]
Can I borrow your underpants for 10 minutes?
That's why they call them crushes. If they were easy, they'd call 'em something else.
What's happenin', hot stuff?
I want a serious girlfriend. Somebody I can love, that's gonna love me back. Is that psycho?
This information cannot leave this room. Okay? It would devastate my reputation as a dude.
No problem.
I've never bagged a babe. I'm not a stud.
[Samantha chuckles]
No more yankie my wankie. The Donger need food!
Donger's here for five hours, and he's got somebody. I live here my whole life, and I'm like a disease.
[ring-ring, no one answers the phone... ]

[as he hangs up]
Ahh, eat me.
Who was it? Well what did they want?

[shocked]
Sex.
[Caroline is very drunk]
Who's he?
That's me.
Who are you?
I'm him.
Oh, okay.
Don't be a smartass.
Ok, I'll be a dumbass.
[Jake rings doorbell at Samantha's house]
Okay. I'm comin'.
[opens closet door]
Hello? Jeez, this place is so confusing. Okay.
[opens front door, screams and shuts door]
Go away! I call F.I.B. I call police! Go away!
Open the door.
No way, Jose!
Open the door.
You beat up my face.
You grabbed my nuts.

[looks through frosted glass on door]
Is that you?
Yeah, that me.

[opens door]
Oh, I'm so sorry. I thought you my new - new-style American girlfriend.
Forget it, man. Just get Samantha, all right?
She not here.
Don't jerk me around, man. Where is she?
She got married.
What?
She at the church. She getting married to oily bohunk.
Married?
Married.
Married?
Yeah. Married
[closes door]

[turns around, under breath to himself]
Married?
Married! Jeez.
[Long Duk Dong is dancing with Lumberjack, his head is on her ample chest]
So... What's your name?
Dong.
What's your first name?
Long.
What's your middle name?
Duk.
I really love Rudy. He is totally enamored of me. I mean, I've had men who've loved me before, but not for six months in a row.
By night's end, I predict me and her will interface.
Why do you think you're a dork? I don't think you're a dork. I don't think Mom thinks you're a dork.
Mike thinks I'm a dork.
Mike *is* a dork.
I can't believe this. They fucking forgot my birthday.

[about Ginny]
Dad, she's got her period. Should make for an interesting honeymoon, huh?
Where are you learning that stuff?
School.
Good. I get my money's worth.
Can you remember to turn off the stove in twenty minutes?
I can remember lots of things.
Oh Sam, let me look at you. Fred, she's gotten her boobies.

[chuckles]
I better go get my magnifying glass.
Oh, and they are so Perky.
[reaches to cup them]

[cut to Sam's bedroom]
I can't believe my Grandmother actually felt me up.
This is Farmer Fred.
Ted.
Oh, I'm sorry, Farmer Ted.
I'm not really a farmer. I'm a freshman.
[last lines]
Thanks for getting my undies back.
Thanks for coming over.
Thanks for coming to get me.
Happy Birthday, Samantha. Make a wish.
It already came true.
Ohhh, sexy girlfriend!... Bonzai!
Damn Mom, I've got my headgear on!

[annoyed]
Will you wake up?

[opens eyes]
Where the hell am I?
I'll, uh, tell you where you are, if you tell me who you are.
I'm Farmer Ted.
You're in the parking lot across the street from my church.
You own a church?

[Farmer Ted is in Jake's dad car. Jake just saw he and Caroline kissing]
I'm dead.
[the phone rings and he answers it]
Hello?
Ted, you never called us back. What happened?
Look, wheez, I told you not to call me here.
Ted, we're dying, what happened?
You wanna know what happened? Buy the book!
[the bride arrives at the church, obviously out of it]
Her monthly bill came early. Well, she's fine, she just took a muscle relaxer.
Try *four*.
Very clever dinner. Appetizing food fit neatly into interesting round pie.
It's a quiche.
How do you spell?
Well you don't spell it, son, you eat it.
[laughs]
Yes, hello sir, um...
Are you the little bugger that's been calling up here all night and then hanging up?
Would it be possible for you to tell me if there is a Samantha Baker there and if so, sir, may I converse with her briefly?
Yes it is, and NO you may not.
Might I leave a message, sir?

[to Grandma Baker]
He wants to leave a message for Sam.

[talking on the phone with Samantha]
Last night at the dance, my little brother paid a buck to see your underwear.

[screams]
Aah!

[Her grandparents are startled by the scream]
Geez! I hate that rock 'n' roll rubbish!
Well, I'm afraid it's here to stay, Howie.
I know I came on kinda like a poozer on the bus tonight and everything. But... that's just so my friends won't think, you know, I'm a jerk.
But they're all pretty much jerks, though, aren't they?
Yeah, but, the thing is, I'm kinda like the leader, you know? Kinda like the king of the dipshits.
Well, that's pretty cool. Hey, but a lot can happen over a year. I mean, you could come back next Fall as a completely normal person.
Would you stop feeling sorry for yourself? It's bad for your complexion.
I'll make a deal with you.
[holds up the panties]
Let me keep these; I'll let you take Caroline home. But you gotta make sure she gets home. You can't leave her in some parking lot somewhere. Okay?
Jake, I'm only a Freshman.
So? She's so blitzed she won't know the difference.
Jake, I don't have a car.
You can take mine.
Jake, I don't have license.
I trust you...
Jake, I'd love to... I can't.
[holds out a bowl]
Want a pretzel?
You sure?
[takes the bowl and sets it down on the counter]
Positive.
How's it goin'?
How's what going?
You know - things, life, whatnot.
Life is not whatnot, and it's none of your business.
When you don't have anything, you don't have anything to lose. Right?
That's a cheerful thought.
Just answer me one question.
Yes, you're a total fag.

[laughs]
That's not the question.
Relax, would you? We have seventy dollars and a pair of girls underpants. We're safe as kittens.
May I be excused?
Where are you going?
I have a dance to go to - at school. It's a very important dance... uh we're being graded on it, for Gym.
[on the phone with the police]
What was he wearing? Well, uh, let's see, he was wearing a red argyle sweater, and tan trousers, and red shoes... Hmm? No, he's not retarded.
Will you shut up? People around here work, alright? And will you hurry it up? I'm breaking like 30 major laws here.
You know, I'm getting input here that I'm reading as relatively hostile. I mean, it's...
Go to hell.
VERY hostile!
I loathe the bus. There has to be a more dignified mode of transportation.
Nice ma - nice manners, babe!
No, Sam, I think you're just being a little selfish... and immature.
Oh, yes, that's it. That's *exactly* it.
[storms out]

[to herself]
Unbelievable. You make someone a bridesmaid and they shit all over you.
I do independent study with her. I catch her lookin' at me a lot. It's kinda cool, the way she's always lookin' at me.
Maybe she's retarded.
I'm being serious, okay? She looks at me like she's in love with me.

[noticing the car Jake puts Caroline in]
This, uh, your car, Jake?
No, this is my dad's car. You said you couldn't drive a stick.
This is a mother - ! This is a Rolls-Royce, Jake.
So?
SO? So? I hear the grill ALONE costs five grand on this. Five grand! Do you have five grand? I don't have five grand!
Then don't hit anything.

[incredulous]
Ha ha! Don't hit anything.

[attempting to help with breakfast by opening a box of doughnuts]
Whoops! Don't wanna use the nails.

[finally opening the box of doughnuts with a knife]
Voila! Breakfast is ready!

[Samantha has filled out an "anonymous" sex quiz naming her crush, which has fallen into unknown hands]
Jake Ryan? He doesn't even know you exist.
Thank you, that's a very nice thing to say.
I'm sorry, but Jake Ryan? He's a Senior, and he's taken. I mean, really taken.
I know. He's supposed to be my ideal.
He's ideal for sure, but, forget it.
God, I hope whoever got the note doesn't know it was me who wrote it. I'd shit twice and die.
Oh my God! What should I do? Should I go up to him and and should I say, "Hi Jake, I'm Samantha", or no, maybe I should let him come to me?
This is not my department.

[to Randy]
Ever since my twelfth, I've been looking forward to my sweet sixteen.
Do I look any older?
No, I wouldn't say so.
I swear to God this has got be a joke.

[mouths from across the street]
Me?
Yeah, you.
[smiles and jogs across the street]

[both in unison]
Hi.
Hi.
Hi. What are you doing here?
I heard you were here.
You came here for me?
Is that okay?

[flattered]
Yeah, it's okay.
Do you have to go to reception now?
I'm supposed to.
Can I call you later?
Sure... I mean no.
No, I can't call you later?
Yeah... No, I mean, I'm not going to the reception.
Oh. Great.
[walks Samantha to his Porsche]

[taking a look at the party's aftermath at his house]
What a disaster.
It's really human of you to listen to all my bullshit.
Dong. Where is my automobile?
Oto-mo-biiile?
[laughing]

[Imitating race car. Imitating crash]
Wreck. Big wreck.
Why, you little scuzzbag!
[She kicks Dong in the groin]

[Jake is now holding Samantha's panties]
These are really hers?
Yeah.
How did you get 'em?
She gave 'em to me.
Did you...?
No! No, Jake. She's cranked for you. I told her you asked about her, right? The girl freaked. She had a hissy. She thinks you're the cats meow!
Really? She came up to me in the gym tonight. She looked at me like I was a leper.
Girls will do that, Jake. You know? You see, they know guys are like in perpetual heat, right? They know they shit, and they enjoy pumping us up. It's pure power politics. I'm telling ya.
I thought she hated my guts.

Games, Jake. Silly torturous games. You know how many times I've gone without lunch because some bitch borrows my lunch money? Any halfway decent girl can rob me - blind! Because I'm too torqued up to say no. It's heinous, I'm telling you.
Do you know how many times a week I go without lunch because some bitch borrows my lunch money? Y'know, any halfway decent girl can rob me blind, because I'm too torqued up to say no.
So, I mean, what's your story? I mean, you got a guy, or...?
Yes, three big ones, and they lust wimp blood, so quit bugging me or I'll sic them all over your weenie ass.
I can't believe I gave my panties to a geek.
Geek, can I be honest with you?
Not if you're gonna insult me.

[laughs]
Okay.
Shoot.
Get the hell outta here.
Hey Howard, there's your Chinaman.
Thanks, Fred.

[to Samantha]
I don't think I'll be able to sleep if I don't feel this little talk has helped ya. So would ya be a sport and lie to me?
Darling, is something bothering you?
[pause]
...you're really acting like... an asshole. And I think I know what it is. I think, you're jealous that I'm getting married and that I'm getting all the attention.
You know everyone in this family has gone total outer limits.
What the hell are you bitchin' about? I gotta sleep under some Chinaman named after a duck's dork.
I thought she hated my guts.
Jake, is your dad a big man, or?
About 6'4".
Very nice.
[repeated line to his friends]
Take those ridiculous things off!

[takes item from Caroline]
Thank you.

[laughs drunkenly]
Now we're both on the pill.
What?
[spits it out]
You gave me a birth control pill? Do you have any idea what that will do to a guy my age?
Then where am I sleeping?
Sofa City, Sweetheart.

[to Sam and Long Duk Dong]
Wait a minute. I have a wonderful idea! Would you like to go to the dance with Sam?
Very nice! We're five minutes in... I'm at a loss.
Real smooth, Cliff.

[Samantha and Randy are watching Caroline taking a shower in the locker room]
It's unbelieveable. I swear to God Caroline Mumford had to flunk about nine grades.
Brother's deaf, and everybody in the world worships her. Practically impossible to cut up. She's supposedly real sweet.
And she's going with Jake. Oh, I'm gonna kill myself.

[to herself in the mirror]
Chronologically, you're sixteen today. Physically, you're still fifteen.
[sighs]
Hopeless.

[while drunk]
You're such a poop.
Ted, that's a Rolls-Royce.

[He sees Caroline passed out in the car]
Ted, that's the prom queen. You got two girls in one night.
I told you dudes I was hot.
Hot? You're a legend!
You better not be dickin' me around. It'd be a major downer to try and get together with this girl and find out that she really does think I'm a slime.
Jake, would I dick you? Let me put it to you this way, what happens to me if I dick you?
I'll kick your ass.

Right! So why would I lie? But I feel compelled to mention to you, Jake, I mean, if all you want of the girl is a piece of ass, I mean, I'll either do it myself, or get someone bigger than me, to kick your ass. I mean, not many girls in contemporary American society today, would give their underwear to help a geek like me.
I can get a piece of ass anytime I want. Shit, I've got Caroline in the bedroom right now, passed out cold. I could violate her ten different ways if I wanted to.

[almost chokes on a pretzel]
What are you waiting for?
I don't know. She's beautiful, and she's built and all that.
[sighs]
I'm just not interested anymore.
Does that really matter, guy?

Yeah, it matters. She's totally insensitive. Look what she did to my house. She doesn't know shit about love. Only thing she cares about is partying. I want a serious girlfriend. Somebody I can love, that's gonna love me back. Is that psycho?
[Spits]
That's beautiful, Jake. I think a ton of guys feel the same way as you do.
Really?
Yeah. It's just they don't... They don't have the balls to admit it. You know? They're just... They're wimps.

[At the dance, about to go to Jake's house]
God, I love it when your parents are out of town. I fantasize that I'm your wife, and we're the richest, most popular adults in town. I owe all my great weekends to you.

[She pauses, upset that Jake isn't excited]
What's your problem?
What?
You've been acting weird all night. Are you screwing around?
Me? Are you crazy?
I don't know, Jake. I'm getting strange signals.
Well, they're not comin' from me. Everything's fine. Don't have a cow.
Okay. Just remember one thing. I can name a hundred guys who'd kill to love me.
Is that a threat?
It's a fact, Jake.
Oh, Sam. Sam, I am so sorry about your birthday.
It's okay. I'll recover.
It's important to you. And yesterday morning, you were trying to tell me.
[Sniffling]
It's okay, Mom. These things sometimes happen.
Oh, honey, I just feel miserable.
You'll feel better.
Who died?
Uh... Is there something you want to say to your sister?
What? Are you kidding? Where should I start?
I mean about her birthday. It was yesterday. We all forgot.

[laughing]
Classic.
Deep down, he's really sorry.

[Together]
No, he's not.

[after they wake up in the Rolls Royce]
I never went out with a freshman. Not even when I was a freshman.
Me either.
You were pretty crazy.
I was?
Yeah. You know what I like best?
My clean, close shave?
The clean, close shave]
No. Waking up in your arms.
These things?
[They start kissing, then Jake shows up]
